resorts.title: Aspen Snowmass
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets range from $189 to $239 USD for a one-day ticket and $124 to $162 USD for a half-day ticket.
resorts.blurb: Located in the Elk Mountains, Aspen Snowmass features four mountains- Aspen, Aspen Highlands, Buttermilk, and Snowmass. The ski resort has 98 trails, 3 terrain parks, and 20 lifts. 5% of runs are beginner, 48% are intermediate, and 47% are advanced.

resorts.title: Whistler Blackcomb
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets range from $186 to $249 CAD for a one-day ticket.
resorts.blurb: Located in the Fitzsimmons Range, Whistler Blackcomb is the largest ski resort in North America. The ski resort has 37 lifts, over 200 trails, and 3 terrain parks. 20% of runs are beginner, 50% are intermediate, and 30% are advanced.

resorts.title: Deer Valley
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets range from $169 to $289 USD for a one-day ticket.
resorts.blurb: Located in the Wasatch Mountains, Deer Valley is one of three ski-only resorts in the United States. The ski resort has 21 lifts and 103 trails. 27% of runs are beginner, 41% are intermediate, and 32% are advanced.

resorts.title: Smugglers’ Notch
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets range from $59 to $95 USD for a one-day ticket and $45 to $72 USD for a half-day ticket.
resorts.Blurb: Located in the Green Mountains and Appalachian Mountains, Smugglers’ Notch features three interconnected mountains- Madonna, Sterling, and Morse. The ski resort has 8 lifts and 78 trails. 19% of runs are beginner, 50% are intermediate, and 31% are advanced.

resorts.title: Big White
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets range from $109 to $189 CAD for a one-day ticket
resorts.blurb: Located in the Beaverdell Range, Big White has some of the cleanest and freshest tap water in the world. The ski resort has 16 lifts and 119 trails. 18% of runs are beginner, 54% are intermediate, and 28% are advanced.

resorts.title: Sun Valley
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets range from $99 to $125 USD for a one-day ticket and $98 for a half-day ticket.
resorts.blurb: Located in the Smoky Mountains, Sun Valley features two mountains- Bald Mountain and Dollar Mountain. The ski resort has 17 lifts and 120 trails. 36% of runs are beginner, 42% are intermediate, and 22% are advanced.

resorts.title: Bretton Woods
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets range from $82 to $109 USD for a one-day ticket.
resorts.blurb: Located in the White Mountains, Bretton Woods has alpine skiing, nordic skiing, snowshoeing, and tubing. The ski resort has 10 lifts and 98 trails. 29% of runs are beginner, 39% are intermediate, and 42% are advanced.

resorts.title: Marmot Basin
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets are $132 CAD for a one-day ticket.
resorts.blurb: Located in the Rocky Mountains, Marmot Basin has spring skiing open all the way until May. The ski resort has 91 trails, 2 terrain parks, and 7 lifts. 30% of runs are beginner, 30% are intermediate, and 40% are advanced.

resorts.title: Killington
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets are range from $64 to $182 USD for a one-day ticket
resorts.blurb: Located in the Green Mountains, Killington hosts the Womens Audi FIS Ski World Cup every year. The ski resort has 155 trails and 21 lifts. 28% of trails are beginner, 33% are intermediate, and 39% are advanced.

resorts.title: Telluride
resorts.price: Adult lift tickets are $215 USD for a one-day ticket.
resorts.blurb: Located in the San Juan Mountains, Telluride is a popular resort that provides a 360-degree view of the surrounding mountains. The ski resort has 148 trails and 19 lifts. 23% of trails are beginner, 36% are intermediate, and 41% are advanced.
